title: UK retailers suffer worst September on record - BRC
text:
UK retailers suffer worst September on record - BRC

Economy 49 minutes ago (Oct 07, 2019 12:15)

© Reuters. FILE PHOTO: Visitors and shoppers walk along Sheep street in the centre of Stratford-upon-Avon LONDON (Reuters) - British retailers endured their worst September since records started in the mid-1990s, a retail survey showed on Monday, adding to signs that the consumer economy is starting to crack in the run-up to Brexit. The British Retail Consortium said total retail sales values declined 1.3% in the year to September. Average growth over the last 12 months declined to 0.2%, the lowest rate on record, the BRC said. The figures had been due at 2301 GMT but the BRC brought forward their publication.
